borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
description: Construction of a part two storey part single storey side and rear extension
decision_conditions:
The proposed development, by reason of siting, scale, mass
and design, would be an overly bulky, discordant addition which would fail to
appear subordinate and sympathetic to the original dwelling, would have an
awkward relationship with the existing dormer window, would substantially close the gap between dwellings and would disrupt the rhythm of the terrace of which it forms a part. This would cause harm to
the character and appearance of the original dwelling, terrace row and surrounding area. The
proposal is therefore found to be at odds with the following policies which
seek to ensure that development proposals have regard to the existing
character:


 National Planning Policy Framework (December 2023)
 Policy D4 London Plan (March 2021)
 Policy CP3 of the Local Development Framework Core
     Strategy (July 2010)
 Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development
     Framework Borough Wide Development Plan Document (March 2011)
 Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary
     Planning Document (February 2012)
 Policies SP2 and DMD6 of The London Borough of
     Barking and Dagenhamâ€™s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission
     Version, December 2021)
